Pre-Game Insights: Jamal Murray's knee flared up pregame, causing him to play only 19 minutes in the game against the Suns.
Russell Westbrook and Jamal Murray are navigating their minutes together, trying to figure out where Murray likes the ball and how to orchestrate the game.

The second unit's chemistry has been complicated by two new additions in Dario Saric and Russell Westbrook, inconsistent minutes together, and a battle between Christian Braun and Julian Strawther for the starting shooting guard spot.
Post-Match Reflections: Jamal Murray told coach Michael Malone that he had been feeling great before the game but his knee started to feel funny during pregame warmups.
Malone said that Murray is mentally and physically tough and has the ability to endure pain, which is why he was able to play through the issue.
Westbrook is trying to help the second unit develop chemistry and an identity, and Malone likes Braun's fit alongside the rest of the starters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets are down to their final two preseason games to develop chemistry and an identity for their second unit.
Zeke Nnaji had a positive performance against the Suns, making four of his five shots and having a presence at the rim and on defense.
Michael Porter Jr. is setting an example for Zeke Nnaji, and Westbrook is teaching rookie Trey Alexander about media training.
Others: The Nuggets are preparing for the regular season, which starts on October 24, and are trying to get the best out of Jamal Murray, who signed a four-year contract extension worth over $208 million this summer.
The team is also trying to figure out their rotation and who will start and play in the second unit.
